author: Acidus
content: There are some really cool attacks you can do with Ajax Bridges/proxies/gateways. Most of the time it makes more sense for an attacker to use the bridge on www.example.com to attack api.datastore.com than to directly attack api.datastore.com Check out slides 37 - 45 (ignore the slanting) http://www.spidynamics.com/spilabs/education/presentations/BillyHoffman-Ajax(in)security.pdf

author: maluc
content:
Wow, the author of stripe snoop..? That code helped me more than you could know, so.. thanks ^^

-maluc

author: Gar
content: I'm probably very naive, but I just wish that browser implementors got rid of cookies in iframes. The only sensible use would be doubleclick and urchin anyway.
